column4: all of a SUDDEN, Ubuntu is running real slow, everything takes ages to load and it seems when something opens, the refresh rates are down from 30 fps to 15fps as it draws windows on screen slowly!  What could have caused this?
maybe something is hogging your memory? G3 inside `top' might help you
i ran top and what should I look for?
type `G3zbx>' in top and try to find some process with a huge VIRT size
_if you don't have anything important open in firefox_, `killall firefox' and see if it helps
it said: firefox: no process killed
hrm, what's the name of the firefox binary? `pgrep -l firefox'
swapon -s and see if it lists hda2
when I typed your command it said: /dev/hda2                               partition       747012  104592  -1
nothing to worry about. is your problem fixed?
so the swap is active and working?
